titles.title: Arctic Deep Water Sea Port Act of 2009

A bill to require a study and report on the feasibility and potential of establishing a deep water sea port in the Arctic to protect and advance strategic United States interests within the evolving and ever more important region.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Armed Services.

bill.summary: 12/8/2009--Introduced. Arctic Deep Water Sea Port Act of 2009 - Directs the Secretary of Defense to conduct a study of, and report to Congress on, the feasibility and potential of establishing a deep water sea port in the Arctic to protect and advance U.S. strategic interests within the Arctic region.
